thread.title: Patrice Bergeron celebrates son's birth, Bruins Twitter community responds hilariously
thread.title_full: Patrice Bergeron celebrates son's birth, Bruins Twitter community responds hilariously

author: Murder charge in road-rage killing of girl, 4
title: Patrice Bergeron celebrates son's birth, Bruins Twitter community responds hilariously
text:
Patrice Bergeron celebrates son's birth, Bruins Twitter community responds hilariously FOXSports 4 hrs ago © NHLI via Getty Images BOSTON, MA - NOVEMBER 15 : Patrice Bergeron #37 of the Boston Bruins dumps the puck against the Carolina Hurricanes at the TD Garden on November 15, 2014 in Boston, Massachusetts. (Photo by Brian Babineau/NHLI via Getty Images) Patrice Bergeron and his wife, Stephanie, welcomed a baby boy named Zack into the world Wednesday morning, and when the news hit Twitter Wednesday afternoon, the Bruins community on the social media website exploded both with joy and with humor.
AdChoices New Englanders regard Bergeron nearly as a saint, and baby Bergeron was celebrated accordingly.
First photo of Zack Bergeron emerges pic.twitter.com/W9MEaitQeO
— Bruins Stats (@bruins_stats) October 21, 2015
The son is born ... RT @DJ_Bean Bruins confirm Bergeron is a new father. Little fella named Zack. pic.twitter.com/BXhsJOa15o
— Matt Kalman (@TheBruinsBlog) October 21, 2015 Bruins fans and reporters also spent time postulating on the newborn's future as a star hockey player.
Zack and Patrice both TBD for game. https://t.co/wed06n8y2n
— Amalie Benjamin (@AmalieBenjamin) October 21, 2015
37's status still TBD because Zack is reportedly such an impressive person that he could play tonight & bat 1000 at the dot. No need for 37.
— DJ Bean (@DJ_Bean) October 21, 2015
Zack Bergeron should be draft eligible by 2033. Hearing his defensive game is already elite.
— ETD51 (@ETD51) October 21, 2015 Based on his father's excellent defensive ability, Zack Bergeron a lot to live up to on the ice.
Word is that his son is already changing his own diaper. Responsible in his own end. https://t.co/8RVQXME3by
— Michael Hurley (@michaelFhurley) October 21, 2015
Zack Bergeron is now third on the Bruins in CF%.
— Chris Abraham (@CrzyCanucklehed) October 21, 2015 Later in the afternoon, Bruins president Cam Neely confirmed in an interview that the new father, who missed morning skate due to the happy occasion, will play in Wednesday night's game against the Flyers.
Congratulations to Patrice and Stephanie Bergeron.
